hackathon-description-text: Kent Hack Enough brings hackers from all over the nation together to learn something new, party hard, and create something awesome. With more than 350 highly motivated, creative, and talented participants, Kent Hack Enough is a weekend-long event where students from all areas of interest come together to make something awesome, like an app, website or hardware hack. The entire event is free for students, including food, energy drinks, and swag. In between all the coding, designing, and water pong, our sponsors are available as mentors to provide help and expertise throughout the hacking process.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Embedded Software Engineer II / Rockwell Automation

hackathon-rules:
We require that all entries be created from scratch, during the competition. The use of 3rd party libraries and APIs is allowed and encouraged. Teams are limited to four people. To provide hackers with the best possible environment for learning, networking, and creating we adhere to the 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A BoogieBoard to the top 3 people with the highest score through scanning the QR codes that each sponsor/event has.
$25 Amazon Gift Cards to the two members who win the Water Pong Tournament
$150 Amazon Gift card to every member of the team that presents the best hack/website on a .tech domain at Kent Hack Enough. Visit

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A BoogieBoard for every member of a newbie team with the best hack!
A HP VR Headset; mixed reality developer edition, is awarded to the winning team sponsored by Cardinal Commerce
A BoogieBoard will be awarded to the members of the top 2 teams in the cup flip tournament

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1125 Risman Dr, Kent, OH 44243, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is your hack actually useful? Does your project solve a problem?
Is this a new idea, or is your project something we see at every other hackathon?
